cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northward, then turning north-northeast and northeast paralleling the Southeast U.S. coastline toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (between Charleston and Myrtle Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County line, FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida through the entire Southeast U.S. coast up to the North Carolina/Virginia border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds with occasional gusts near minimal hurricane strength expected to diminish overnight.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible along the Northeast Florida coast and the St. Johns River near Jacksonville.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated totals to 6 inches could trigger flash flooding in low-lying and poorly drained areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and an isolated tornado risk along the Northeast Florida coast.
